We went through, as we talked about the ark many lessons ago, we talked about the size of the ark and how many freight cars of, you know, cubic feet that they had for storage and so on and so forth, sufficiently sized for all these creatures. Let me say this, Noah took all the animals on the ark, including dinosaurs, but we also understand as we read the Genesis flood, that all living creatures that were not on the ark died. Genesis 7, continue reading, look down at verse 21. The Bible says, "...and all flesh died that moved upon the earth, both of fowl and of cattle and of beasts and of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth, and every man and in whose nostrils was the breath of life, of all that was in the dry land died." Verse 23 of Genesis 7, "...and every living substance was destroyed which was upon the face of the ground, both man and cattle and the creeping thing and the fowl of the heaven, and they were destroyed from the earth, and Noah only remained alive and they that were with him in the ark, and the waters prevailed upon the earth in a hundred and fifty days." And so all living creatures that were not on the ark died. So there were lives. lots of dinosaurs that died during the flood. We don't know the number, but we do know this,
